    • Method Detail

      • getHeaderId

        long getHeaderId(int position)
        Get the ID of the header associated with this item. For example, if your headers group items by their first letter, you could return the character representation of the first letter. Return a value < 0 if the view should not have a header (like, a header view or footer view)
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the view to get the header ID of
        Returns:
        the header ID

      • onCreateHeaderViewHolder

        VH onCreateHeaderViewHolder(android.view.ViewGroup parent)
        Creates a new ViewHolder for a header. This works the same way onCreateViewHolder in Recycler.Adapter, ViewHolders can be reused for different views. This is usually a good place to inflate the layout for the header.
        Parameters:
        parent - the view to create a header view holder for
        Returns:
        the view holder

      • onBindHeaderViewHolder

        void onBindHeaderViewHolder(VH holder,
                          int position)
        Binds an existing ViewHolder to the specified adapter position.
        Parameters:
        holder - the view holder
        position - the adapter position

      • getItemCount

        int getItemCount()
        Returns:
        the number of views in the adapter
